Claim: A video shows pigs buried in China because of the coronavirus.
Explaination: The video showing the mass burial of pigs in China is unrelated with the recent Wuhan virus outbreak. The video is a year old and shows the mass burial of pigs after the outbreak of the African swine fever virus.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video shows pigs buried in China because of the coronavirus.

Explanation:The video showing the mass burial of pigs in China is unrelated with the recent Wuhan virus outbreak. The video is a year old and shows the mass burial of pigs after the outbreak of the African swine fever virus.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/burial-of-pigs-shared-with-misleading-context/

Claim: Consuming colloidal silver can prevent or treat novel coronavirus.
Explaination: US regulators say consuming silver is not safe for use against any disease.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Consuming colloidal silver can prevent or treat novel coronavirus.

Explanation:US regulators say consuming silver is not safe for use against any disease.

https://factcheck.afp.com/consuming-silver-particles-will-not-prevent-or-treat-novel-coronavirus

Claim: A photo showing the bodies of Italian COVID-19 victims on a street.
Explaination: The 2014 photo shows participants in an art project to remember victims of the Nazi Katzbac concentration camp in Frankfurt, Germany.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A photo showing the bodies of Italian COVID-19 victims on a street.

Explanation:The 2014 photo shows participants in an art project to remember victims of the Nazi Katzbac concentration camp in Frankfurt, Germany.

https://pesacheck.org/false-this-photo-does-not-show-the-bodies-of-covid-19-victims-on-an-italian-street-e5070814218a?source=rss----ab41f21aa9a9---4

Claim: Cow urine is helpful to fight coronavirus.
Explaination: No scientific evidence backs the use of cow urine to tackle viruses.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Cow urine is helpful to fight coronavirus.

Explanation:No scientific evidence backs the use of cow urine to tackle viruses.

https://www.boomlive.in/factcheck/can-cow-urine-or-gaumutra-cure-coronavirus-what-we-know-7308

Claim: Speaking of his restriction on travel from China, President Donald Trump claims: “I had (Joe) Biden calling me xenophobic … He called me a racist, because of the fact that he felt it was a racist thing to stop people from China coming in.”
Explaination: Biden has not directly said that the restrictions were xenophobic. Around the time the Trump administration announced the travel restriction,  Biden said that Trump had a “record of hysteria, xenophobia, and fear-mongering.”
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: Speaking of his restriction on travel from China, President Donald Trump claims: “I had (Joe) Biden calling me xenophobic … He called me a racist, because of the fact that he felt it was a racist thing to stop people from China coming in.”

Explanation:Biden has not directly said that the restrictions were xenophobic. Around the time the Trump administration announced the travel restriction, Biden said that Trump had a “record of hysteria, xenophobia, and fear-mongering.”

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/mar/27/donald-trump/fact-checking-whether-biden-called-trump-xenophobi/

Claim: Viral post along with a pictures claims civilian thrashing a policeman during lockdown.
Explaination: The viral photos are three years old and have nothing to do with the coronavirus lockdown.
Label: Mostly false
html:
Claim: Viral post along with a pictures claims civilian thrashing a policeman during lockdown.

Explanation:The viral photos are three years old and have nothing to do with the coronavirus lockdown.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/did-policeman-get-beaten-up-while-enforcing-corona-lockdown-1660775-2020-03-28

Claim: A video viewed thousands of times in Nigeria and shared in multiple Facebook posts claims to show police in Spain rounding up people aged 50 and above to transfer them to quarantine centers amid the novel coronavirus pandemic.
Explaination: The claim is false; the footage was circulating months before the outbreak and actually shows police in Azerbaijan detaining anti-government protesters in the capital Baku.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video viewed thousands of times in Nigeria and shared in multiple Facebook posts claims to show police in Spain rounding up people aged 50 and above to transfer them to quarantine centers amid the novel coronavirus pandemic.

Explanation:The claim is false; the footage was circulating months before the outbreak and actually shows police in Azerbaijan detaining anti-government protesters in the capital Baku.

https://factcheck.afp.com/video-was-shot-azerbaijan-october-2019-during-anti-government-protest

Claim: An image shared on social media claims this Italian doctor couple worked day and night and saved the lives of 134 patients, but on the eighth day, they contracted the coronavirus and died after an hour.
Explaination: The couple in the picture is not Italian but a couple from Spain. The photograph was taken at Barcelona Airport on March 12, 2020.
Label: False
html:
Claim: An image shared on social media claims this Italian doctor couple worked day and night and saved the lives of 134 patients, but on the eighth day, they contracted the coronavirus and died after an hour.

Explanation:The couple in the picture is not Italian but a couple from Spain. The photograph was taken at Barcelona Airport on March 12, 2020.

https://www.newschecker.in/article/news-detail/275_15350708?check=2

Claim: Nancy Pelosi tried to secure taxpayer funds for abortion through a coronavirus bill.
Explaination: Pelosi never inserted abortion funding in a coronavirus bill. However, some conservatives said by failing to specifically say money couldn’t be used for abortions, that would leave open the possibility that federal money could be used for abortions.
Label: Misleading
html:
Claim: Nancy Pelosi tried to secure taxpayer funds for abortion through a coronavirus bill.

Explanation:Pelosi never inserted abortion funding in a coronavirus bill. However, some conservatives said by failing to specifically say money couldn’t be used for abortions, that would leave open the possibility that federal money could be used for abortions.

https://youtu.be/SVeOKGSWPjs

Claim: Utility companies Manila Electric Company (Meralco) and Maynilad Water Services Inc are waiving their billings for March 2020 due to the coronavirus crisis.
Explaination: The graphic did not come from the official channels of Meralco and Maynilad. The two utility services are only offering an extension for payments, not cancellation of fees.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Utility companies Manila Electric Company (Meralco) and Maynilad Water Services Inc are waiving their billings for March 2020 due to the coronavirus crisis.

Explanation:The graphic did not come from the official channels of Meralco and Maynilad. The two utility services are only offering an extension for payments, not cancellation of fees.

https://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/fact-check/257111-meralco-maynilad-waive-march-2020-billings

Claim: Photo of a mannequin being wheeled into a hospital shows the COVID-19 coverup.
Explaination: The picture of the dummy on a stretcher going into a hospital is an actual photo, but it's from the U.S. Navy. It shows sailors practicing transferring patients from a pier in New York City onto the USNS Comfort hospital ship in support of the nation's COVID-19 response efforts.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Photo of a mannequin being wheeled into a hospital shows the COVID-19 coverup.

Explanation:The picture of the dummy on a stretcher going into a hospital is an actual photo, but it's from the U.S. Navy. It shows sailors practicing transferring patients from a pier in New York City onto the USNS Comfort hospital ship in support of the nation's COVID-19 response efforts.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/04/Fact-Check-Photo-Of-Mannequin-Being-Wheeled-Into-Hospital-Does-NOT-Prove-There-Is-A-Coronavirus-Cover-Up.html

Claim: Using sauna or aiming a hairdryer at one’s nose will kill the coronavirus.
Explaination: Expert in infectious diseases said it won't make any impact against coronavirus, and the heat could be damaging if excessive.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Using sauna or aiming a hairdryer at one’s nose will kill the coronavirus.

Explanation:Expert in infectious diseases said it won't make any impact against coronavirus, and the heat could be damaging if excessive.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/03/fact-check-using-a-sauna-or-hairdryer-will-not-kill-coronavirus.html

Claim: Popping bubble wrap exposes people to coronavirus.
Explaination: Bubble wrap is not produced by people blowing air into the plastic. Claim originated from a satirical Facebook page that was shut down.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Popping bubble wrap exposes people to coronavirus.

Explanation:Bubble wrap is not produced by people blowing air into the plastic. Claim originated from a satirical Facebook page that was shut down.

https://hoax-alert.leadstories.com/3471700-fake-news-popping-bubble-wrap-does-not-expose-people-to-coronavirus.html

Claim: If you drink water with lemon, it prevents the new coronavirus.
Explaination: There’s no scientific evidence to support this theory. Health authorities have never made any recommendations regarding water and lemon. It’s not proved.
Label: False
html:
Claim: If you drink water with lemon, it prevents the new coronavirus.

Explanation:There’s no scientific evidence to support this theory. Health authorities have never made any recommendations regarding water and lemon. It’s not proved.

https://observador.pt/factchecks/beber-agua-morna-com-limao-previne-o-contagio-pelo-coronavirus/?check=1

Claim: This coronavirus-infected patient reached to Dr. Vinod Kumar but he wasn’t given the treatment. He was later referred to Bhagalpur. It further states that one should avoid meat and fish for 3 months and wear mask to protect yourself from coronavirus.
Explaination: The post claiming that coronavirus infected patient reached Bihar and is not given treatment is fake. Health authorities dismiss the hoax report. Further, WHO has also not recommended to avoid fish and meat. It recommended thoroughly cooking meat and eggs. Wearing mask is, however, advisable.
Label: FALSE
html:
Claim: This coronavirus-infected patient reached to Dr. Vinod Kumar but he wasn’t given the treatment. He was later referred to Bhagalpur. It further states that one should avoid meat and fish for 3 months and wear mask to protect yourself from coronavirus.

Explanation:The post claiming that coronavirus infected patient reached Bihar and is not given treatment is fake. Health authorities dismiss the hoax report. Further, WHO has also not recommended to avoid fish and meat. It recommended thoroughly cooking meat and eggs. Wearing mask is, however, advisable.

https://www.vishvasnews.com/english/health/fact-check-no-confirmed-case-of-coronavirus-reported-in-purnia-so-far-fake-post-getting-viral/

Claim: Doctors and nurses in Italy are dying and are lying dead on the ground due to the coronavirus outbreak.
Explaination: The image does not depict dead doctors and nurses in Italy. It is a part of a demonstration by youngsters to spread awareness about coronavirus in Bogota.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Doctors and nurses in Italy are dying and are lying dead on the ground due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Explanation:The image does not depict dead doctors and nurses in Italy. It is a part of a demonstration by youngsters to spread awareness about coronavirus in Bogota.

https://english.factcrescendo.com/2020/03/24/fact-check-image-showing-doctors-and-nurses-dead-in-italy/

Claim: A post says that, on 3/22/20, 793 people died in Italy and included 232 kids.
Explaination: In that day, 651 people died in Italy due to the new coronavirus and there were no mention to children. None of the deaths were related to child infections.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A post says that, on 3/22/20, 793 people died in Italy and included 232 kids.

Explanation:In that day, 651 people died in Italy due to the new coronavirus and there were no mention to children. None of the deaths were related to child infections.

https://observador.pt/factchecks/fact-check-das-793-mortes-num-dia-em-italia-232-eram-criancas/

Claim: A video shows domesticated and exotic animals being sold in a wet market in Wuhan, China.
Explaination: The video currently being spread on social media is a composite of two different clips, one of Langowan Traditional Market and the other of Tomohon Traditional Market, both in Indonesia.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A video shows domesticated and exotic animals being sold in a wet market in Wuhan, China.

Explanation:The video currently being spread on social media is a composite of two different clips, one of Langowan Traditional Market and the other of Tomohon Traditional Market, both in Indonesia.

https://verafiles.org/articles/vera-files-fact-check-video-bats-snakes-other-animals-sold-w

Claim: A Nigerian taxi driver threatens to spread COVID-19.
Explaination: The story originated from a parody account and has been denied by the man pictured in the claim and government officials.
Label: False
html:
Claim: A Nigerian taxi driver threatens to spread COVID-19.

Explanation:The story originated from a parody account and has been denied by the man pictured in the claim and government officials.

https://factcheck.afp.com/story-originated-parody-account-no-driver-threatening-spread-covid-19-across-nigeria

Claim: Numerous conspiracy theories shared on and off social media claim that 5G mobile networks are the cause of the novel coronavirus pandemic.
Explaination: This is false; experts told AFP that 5G is based on radio frequency and that this does not create viruses.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Numerous conspiracy theories shared on and off social media claim that 5G mobile networks are the cause of the novel coronavirus pandemic.

Explanation:This is false; experts told AFP that 5G is based on radio frequency and that this does not create viruses.

https://factcheck.afp.com/experts-dismiss-claims-5g-wireless-technology-created-novel-coronavirus

Claim: Chinese people are fleeing China to Vietnam because of coronavirus.
Explaination: People are actually going from Vietnam to China for work.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Chinese people are fleeing China to Vietnam because of coronavirus.

Explanation:People are actually going from Vietnam to China for work.

https://observers.france24.com/fr/20200221-coronavirus-intox-hordes-chinois-fuient-vietnam-courant

Claim: COVID-19 came from Chinese people eating human babies, in an effort to improve their skin.
Explaination: The netizen’s claim about COVID-19 coming from eating babies is false and baseless. The photos used are also all over a decade old, some of which show a Chinese man "eating babies" as a protest art in 2000.
Label: False
html:
Claim: COVID-19 came from Chinese people eating human babies, in an effort to improve their skin.

Explanation:The netizen’s claim about COVID-19 coming from eating babies is false and baseless. The photos used are also all over a decade old, some of which show a Chinese man "eating babies" as a protest art in 2000.

https://verafiles.org/articles/vera-files-fact-check-fb-post-claiming-chinese-people-eat-ba

Claim: “Now, they’re doing tests on airlines — very strong tests — for getting on, getting off. They’re doing tests on trains — getting on, getting off.”
Explaination: The CDC is not testing passengers for COVID-19 as they get on or off airplanes and trains. The federal government is screening certain passengers at 13 airports.
Label: Pants on Fire!
html:
Claim: “Now, they’re doing tests on airlines — very strong tests — for getting on, getting off. They’re doing tests on trains — getting on, getting off.”

Explanation:The CDC is not testing passengers for COVID-19 as they get on or off airplanes and trains. The federal government is screening certain passengers at 13 airports.

https://www.politifact.com/factchecks/2020/apr/06/donald-trump/donald-trump-wrong-about-covid-19-testing-airplane/

Claim: Belgium’s health minister banned sex inside or with 3 or more people.
Explaination: This is a satirical article.
Label: False
html:
Claim: Belgium’s health minister banned sex inside or with 3 or more people.

Explanation:This is a satirical article.

https://leadstories.com/hoax-alert/2020/03/fact-check-belgium-health-minister-did-NOT-put-ban-on-non-essential-sexual-activities-of-persons-3-or-great.html

Claim: CDC recommends that people shave their facial hair to prevent coronavirus.
Explaination: No such recommendations have been made by CDC so far.
Label: False
html:
Claim: CDC recommends that people shave their facial hair to prevent coronavirus.

Explanation:No such recommendations have been made by CDC so far.

https://www.indiatoday.in/fact-check/story/no-us-health-body-has-not-recommended-shaving-facial-hair-prevent-coronavirus-1660754-2020-03-28
